snippet: President Obama’s 2013 inauguration will be low-key, compared with 2009’s festivities, but this year corporate donations, with some exceptions, will be welcome.
abstract: Pres Obama's inaugural committee says his 2013 inaugural festivities will be low-key, compared to 2009, and that he will accept unlimited donations from corporations — but no money from lobbyists or political action committees — to finance events.
lead_paragraph: President Obama’s 2013 inauguration will be low-key, compared with 2009’s festivities, but this year corporate donations, with some exceptions, will be welcome.

headline.seo: Obama to Accept Corporate Donations for 2013 Inaugural Events
headline.main: Corporate Money Allowed for Inaugural Donations
headline.print_headline: Corporate Money Allowed For Inaugural Donations
